aas:langStringTextType.aas:text:
To carry out a preference calculation, customs-specific master data is required for all installed parts within a product. For this purpose, the manufacturer of the product requests this information from the relevant suppliers for all purchased parts (part numbers)and uses it for the preference calculation.
The exchange takes place peer-to-peer from one value-added participant across the two tier levels.

CustomsInformation contains all customs-related information for a long-term supplier's declaration for a part. Long-term supplier's declarations (LLE)are one-off declarations that are valid for deliveries over a longer period of time, provided that the delivered goods are expected to have the same origin status.
Entity of the origin of manufacturing.

To carry out a preference calculation, customs-specific master data is required for all installed parts within a product. For this purpose, the manufacturer of the product requests this information from the relevant suppliers for all purchased parts (part numbers)and uses it for the preference calculation.
The exchange takes place peer-to-peer from one value-added participant across the two tier levels.

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text:
To carry out a preference calculation, customs-specific master data is required for all installed parts within a product. For this purpose, the manufacturer of the product requests this information from the relevant suppliers for all purchased parts (part numbers)and uses it for the preference calculation.
The exchange takes place peer-to-peer from one value-added participant across the two tier levels.
The trade relation (preferential agreement)for which origin information has been provided.
The term "Commercial Country Of Origin" specifically refers to the country where the goods were originally produced, manufactured or significantly transformed
German federal state in which the part was manufactured.
This is the preference status of the part.
Value of traced Value depending on the currency.
This is the currency of the traced value.
Material value of the part in a currency unit.
Name of the person responsible for the customs information provided.
Jobtitle of the responsible for the customs information provided.
E-Mail of the responsible for the customs information provided.
Phone number of the responsible for the customs information provided.
Contact information for the responsible.
Longitude of the manufacturing place.
Latiitude of the manufacturing place.
Information of the Manufacturing place.
OriginInformation contains all the information required to determine that the part is eligible for preferential treatment, i.e. the determination of preferential origin.
Confirmation Date is the date of issue of a long-term supplier's declaration.
Valid From is the date from which a long-term supplier declaration is valid. This date can be in the future.
Type is the reason for submitting a long-term supplier's declaration. This may be due to a recurring annual enquiry by the customer or at the start of a supply relationship.
Status represents the stage of a long-term supplier's declaration. Committed indicates to the data recipient that all data has been provided correctly.

CustomsInformation contains all customs-related information for a long-term supplier's declaration for a part. Long-term supplier's declarations (LLE)are one-off declarations that are valid for deliveries over a longer period of time, provided that the delivered goods are expected to have the same origin status.
The fully anonymous Catena-X ID of the corresponding part, valid for the Catena-X dataspace.
